[h1]‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ (7/10)[/h1]

[i]Ricochet[/i] is basically [i]Half-Life mods gone wild[/i]: you hop on neon discs, throw glowing frisbees at other people and fall into the void. A lot.

I think around 2001 it was designed as a demonstration of how the [i]Half-Life SDK[/i] and GoldSrc engine could be used to make mods. It was then released as a free mod for [i]Half-Life[/i]. When Valve began porting their GoldSrc games over to Steam in 2003, [i]Ricochet[/i] was changed to a paid product (with no updates) and released as a standalone title. Owners of the earlier retail copies of [i]Half-Life[/i] were automatically granted access to it. 

You‚Äôll be surprised at how funny the game can be with friends or if you want to wait for a lobby of players to turn up. We used to play this a lot as a warm-up to [i]Unreal Tournament[/i] and [i]Quake III[/i] nights.
